intro: Hymenochilus cycnocephalus, commonly known as the white-lipped twayblade, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is a terrestrial herb with a slender, creeping rhizome and a single, pale green to white leaf. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, Sri Lanka, and parts of Southeast Asia. Hymenochilus cycnocephalus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and grasslands.
